alert.note: Alert for Colbert; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 2:15AM CST until March 03 at 4:14PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tennessee River AT Florence affecting Colbert and Lauderdale Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River AT Florence. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Alabama State Highway 20 is flooded at the underpass below U.S. Highways 43 and 72. The underpass will likely be closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 AM CST Saturday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 20.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 20.3 feet and begin rising again this evening. It will rise to 20.8 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall to 19.2 feet and begin rising again early Wednesday morning. It will rise to 19.3 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.8 feet on 09/20/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
